Package javelin.controller.event

Class EventDealer

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.event.EventDealer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    UrbanEvents, WildEvents
    public abstract class EventDealer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Draws EventCards. Some care is taken so that the available decks (positive, neutral and negative) will remember which cards are drawn or not. This is to ensure that, as much as possible, events don't repeat. If decks ever run out of valid cards to generate, used cards will be entirely reshuffled.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      static class  EventDealer.EventDeck
      An infinitely-drawing deck of EventCards.

    • Method Detail

      • generate

        public EventCard generate​(Squad s,
                          int el)
        Parameters:
        s - Usually Squad.active.
        el - Encounter level of the given Squad.
        l - The PointOfInterest Location.
        Returns:
        A valid, defined event ready to be used with equal chances of being positive, neutral or negative.

      • choosedeck

        protected EventDealer.EventDeck choosedeck()
        Returns:
        By default, equal chances of positive, neutral and negative.

      • printsummary

        ContentSummary

      • newinstance

        protected EventCard newinstance​(java.lang.Class<? extends EventCard> type)
                         throws java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException
        Given a type of card, instantiate it. Subclasses may have different Constructors so this allows the execution of the proper reflection operations. This is only responsible for returning a Constructor.newInstance(Object...). Other operations, such as validation are performed elsewhere.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException
        See Also:
        WildEvents.generating, UrbanEvents.generating
